Archetypes.Name: Classic Arc (Freytag)
Archetypes.Description: A classic rise and fall structure suitable for most stories.

Archetypes.Name: Hero's Journey
Archetypes.Description: A circular journey where the hero leaves home and returns changed.

Archetypes.Name: The Twist (Kishōtenketsu)
Archetypes.Description: An East Asian structure with four acts: Intro, Development, Twist, and Conclusion.

ArchetypePoints.Label: Beginning
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: How does the story start? Describe the normal world.

ArchetypePoints.Label: Inciting Incident
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: What event changes everything for the hero?

ArchetypePoints.Label: Rising Action
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: What obstacles does the hero face along the way?

ArchetypePoints.Label: Falling Action
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: What happens immediately after the climax?

ArchetypePoints.Label: Resolution
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: How does the story end? What is the new normal?

ArchetypePoints.Label: Ordinary World
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: Describe the hero's life before the adventure.

ArchetypePoints.Label: Call to Adventure
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: Who or what calls them to action?

ArchetypePoints.Label: Threshold
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: The hero leaves home and enters the unknown.

ArchetypePoints.Label: The Ordeal
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: The central crisis where the hero faces their greatest fear.

ArchetypePoints.Label: The Road Back
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: The hero must return home with what they learned.

ArchetypePoints.Label: Return w/ Elixir
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: The hero returns home, changed forever.

ArchetypePoints.Label: Introduction (Ki)
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: Introduce the characters and their world.

ArchetypePoints.Label: Development (Shō)
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: Deepen the story. What are they doing? (No major conflict yet)

ArchetypePoints.Label: The Twist (Ten)
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: Surprise! Something unexpected happens that changes everything.

ArchetypePoints.Label: Conclusion (Ketsu)
ArchetypePoints.Prompt: How does the story settle after the twist?

ArchetypeExamples.Title: The Wizard of Oz
ArchetypeExamples.Content: Dorothy lives on a gray, dry prairie in Kansas with Aunt Em and Uncle Henry. Her life is dull, and she dreams of 'Somewhere Over the Rainbow'.

ArchetypeExamples.Title: The Wizard of Oz
ArchetypeExamples.Content: The mean Miss Gulch takes Toto away with a sheriff's order to be destroyed. Toto escapes, but Dorothy decides she must run away to keep him safe.

ArchetypeExamples.Title: The Wizard of Oz
ArchetypeExamples.Content: A cyclone rips the farmhouse from the ground and deposits it in the colorful Land of Oz. Dorothy opens the door to a technicolor world, leaving the black-and-white Kansas behind.

ArchetypeExamples.Title: The Wizard of Oz
ArchetypeExamples.Content: Dorothy and her friends are captured by Flying Monkeys and trapped in the Wicked Witch's castle. The hour glass is running out!

ArchetypeExamples.Title: The Wizard of Oz
ArchetypeExamples.Content: The Wizard offers to take Dorothy home in his balloon, but it accidentally launches while she is chasing Toto, leaving her stranded again.

ArchetypeExamples.Title: The Wizard of Oz
ArchetypeExamples.Content: Dorothy learns she had the power all along. She taps her ruby slippers three times, says 'There's no place like home', and wakes up in her own bed surrounded by her family.
